definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Some of you are probably already scratching your heads.
sentences.chinese: 有些读者可能已经在挠头了。

sentences.english: Other networks have wrestled with the same issues.
sentences.chinese: 而别的电视网正在为同样的问题挠头。

sentences.english: The decision has left many scratching their heads.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定令很多人直挠头皮感到困惑。

sentences.english: Under stage Zhang Hanyu shames adeptly scratches the head.
sentences.chinese: 台下的张涵予羞得拿手挠头。

sentences.english: Economists are scratching their heads to explain the price jump.
sentences.chinese: 如何解释肉价暴涨让经济学家挠头不已。

sentences.english: Mr. Bailey was searching for Mrs. McKinley and scratching his head.
sentences.chinese: 贝利先生正在找麦丽金夫人，也正在为此事而挠头。

sentences.english: On the girl's shoulder sat a little marmoset scratching its head comically.
sentences.chinese: 在女孩的肩膀上坐着一只正在挠头的小猴子。

definition: to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
to scratch/old variant of 騷|骚[sao1]
to feel embarrassed/to find it embarrassing/to be sorry (for inconveniencing sb)
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
